person.persName: William H. Hays (Inspector General of Kentucky)

body.p: Washington County, Kentucky, native. Son of William Hays and Eleanor Burcham. Admitted to the bar in 1845. Attorney in Springfield in 1850. Elected County Judge of Washington County in 1851 and 1854. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1861. Served in 10th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as lieutenant colonel from March 11, 1863, to March 11, 1863, and colonel from March 11, 1863, to December 6, 1864. Inspector general of Kentucky in 1865. Owned twenty-seven enslaved persons in 1850. Owned thirty enslaved persons in 1860.
